posts.post_content: Well, there's also the -0/-1. Although, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to take a look at what else was available for red to play available-for-blocking games with (besides just blasting the blockers away, that is).

Posted By: Skyknight (4/12/2010 7:52:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It could be OK for taking care of annoying one-drops or two-drops like [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), [Dark Confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confidant) or [Noble Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Hierarch). It's also a red card that can get rid of indestructible creatures like [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll) or [Darksteel Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Myr). Most red burn spells can't take care of indestructible cards like those.   
  
Not a great card by any stretch, but not nearly as horrible as other cards out there. It's kind of stupid that it's rare though.
posts.html:
It could be OK for taking care of annoying one-drops or two-drops like Birds of Paradise, Dark Confidant or Noble Hierarch. It's also a red card that can get rid of indestructible creatures like Stuffy Doll or Darksteel Myr. Most red burn spells can't take care of indestructible cards like those.

Not a great card by any stretch, but not nearly as horrible as other cards out there. It's kind of stupid that it's rare though.

Posted By: SirZapdos (11/16/2011 12:00:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This raises interesting questions. I always thought [Ironclaw Orcs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ironclaw Orcs) couldn't block big creatures because of everyday cowardice, but the existence of this card seems to imply that there's actually some sort of *enchantment* causing them to run away like [little girl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=little girl)s every time they see a [Pearled Unicorn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pearled Unicorn)! Isn't that curious?  
  
Incidentally, if you've never played Homelands in Limited (in which case you should consider yourself lucky), this is actually a pretty high pick as a surprisingly solid removal spell in such a low-powered environment.  
  
@ Superllama, remember that you can always play this postcombat.
